data.event: Stanton was organized in 1860 when the people of Montcalm County voted to move the county seat here from Greenville, which was the original county seat from 1840.

event.title: became its first postmaster on March 10, 1862

data.event: The family of Levi Camburn was the first to settle here and he became its first postmaster on March 10, 1862.

event.title: was renamed for Secretary of War, Edwin M. Stanton in 1863

data.event: The city was renamed for Secretary of War, Edwin M. Stanton in 1863.
Stanton was platted in 1865, incorporated as a village in 1869, and as a city in 1881.
Stanton was platted in 1865, incorporated as a village in 1869, and as a city in 1881.
